entry.title: The 2nd Annual City Reliquary Benefit Gala
entry.summary: THE 2ND ANNUAL CITY RELIQUARY BENEFIT GALA MONDAY, DECEMBER 10, 2007, BEGINNING AT 7 PM A PRESENTATION AND GALA DINNER...
entry.content:
THE 2ND ANNUAL CITY RELIQUARY BENEFIT GALA
MONDAY, DECEMBER 10, 2007, BEGINNING AT 7 PM
A PRESENTATION AND GALA DINNER
The Presentation will be held at the Automotive High School Auditorium
Located in McCarren Park, Williamsburgh, Brooklyn

Featured Guest: LAWRENCE WESCHLER, Author of "Mr. Wilson's Cabinet of Wonder", Director of the New York Institute for the Humanities at NYU

Brooklyn Dodgers Presentation: PAUL LUKAS, ESPN.Com Uni Watch Columnist
& Author of "Inconspicuous Consumption"

Musical Performance:LOS BOMBEROS DE BROOKLYN, multi-generational Puerto Rican Bomba, Rhythm and Dance Group from Williamsburgh's Southside

And Excerpts from the unreleased film: UP ON THE ROOF a documentary on the rooftop pigeon keepers of Williamsburgh's Southside
by JL ARONSON, Producer/Director of "Danielson: A Family Movie"

The Presentation will be followed by Limousine Service
to a VERY SPECIAL DINNER Beginning at 9:00 PM at BAMONTE'S RESTAURANT, Williamsburgh's Most Historic Italian Restaurant

TICKETS: Auditorium Presentation only: $30 (At the Door)
Auditorium and Dinner: $125 (RSVP Required)
RSVP by Monday, Dec. 3rd: By phone to (718)R.U.Civic (782-4842)
or email to RSVP@CITY RELIQUARY.ORG
DONATIONS: If you are unable to attend and wish to make a donation
Electronic Donations: www.cityreliquary.org
Checks: made payable to Friends of the City Reliquary, Inc.
PO Box 110-948
Williamsburgh Station
Brooklyn, NY 11211

written and performed by LuLu LoLo

Free and Open to the Public
Call 631.632.7444 for more information

entry.title: LuLu LoLo in Henry's Lunchroom by Dan Evans
entry.summary: LuLu LoLo (The Widow Douglas) & Dan Evans are back at Metropolitan Playhouse for Twainathon: A Festival of plays inspired...
entry.content:
LuLu LoLo (The Widow Douglas) & Dan Evans are back at Metropolitan Playhouse for Twainathon: A Festival of plays inspired by Mark Twain---
Ernest Hemingway once said that American Literature begins with Mark Twain's "Huckleberry Finn". It could also be said that American literature truly begins with Hemingway's short story "The Killers" (1926). Here in Hannibal, Missouri, in 1850, young Tom Sawyer and the killers Al and Max are brought together in HENRY'S LUNCHROOM written and directed by Dan Evans
www.metropolitanplayhouse.org Twainathon: Riverboat C:
Wed. Jan. 17; Sat. Jan. 20; Tues. Jan.23 @7pm
& Sat. Jan. 27 @10pm
Tickets: $18 students & seniors: $15
Call: 212.995.5302 limited seating reservations suggested

entry.title: LuLu LoLo new play
entry.summary: LuLu LoLo new one-person play: 38 WITNESSED HER DEATH, I WITNESSED HER LOVE: The Lonely Secret of Mary Ann Zielonko...
entry.content: LuLu LoLo new one-person play: 38 WITNESSED HER DEATH, I WITNESSED HER LOVE: The Lonely Secret of Mary Ann Zielonko (Kitty Genovese Story). Written and performed by LuLu LoLo based on interviews with Mary Ann Zielonko--was performed in Provincetown, MA during Women's Week, Oct. 2006. In 1964 Kitty Genovese was murdered in Kew Gardens, Queens while 38 people witnessed the crime--none of them called the police or came to her aid. No one wanted to get involved. On the 40th anniversary of Kitty's death it was revealed that Kitty was a Lesbian and lived in Kew Gardens with her partner Mary Ann Zielonko. Forty years after Kitty's death Mary Ann Zielonko granted her first interview.

entry.title: Rest in Peace, FDNY Brothers.
entry.summary: The signal 5-5-5-5 was transmitted by the FDNY at 2018 hrs on August 27th 2006, and again at 1323 hrs...
entry.content:
The signal 5-5-5-5 was transmitted by the FDNY at 2018 hrs on August 27th 2006,
and again at 1323 hrs on August 28th, 2006 for our fallen brothers,
FF Michael C. Reilly and Lt. Howard J. Carpluk Jr.

"It is with regret the department announces the deaths of Firefighter 6th Grade Michael C. Reilly of Engine Company 75 and Lieutenant Howard J. Carpluk Jr. of Engine Company 42, which occured on Sunday August 27, 2006 as a result of injuries sustained while operating at Bronx box 33-2797 transmitted at 1229 hrs on August 27, 2006."

Funeral Mass will be held for Michael Reilly on Friday, September 1st, and for Howard Carpluk Jr. on Saturday September 2nd.

Rest in peace, brothers.

entry.title: Feeding Desire - Inspector Collector
entry.summary: 10 ice cream spoons and paddles from my collection are on display at the Smithsonian’s Cooper Hewitt National Design Museum...
entry.content: 10 ice cream spoons and paddles from my collection are on display at the Smithsonian’s Cooper Hewitt National Design Museum in a show called Feeding Desire (about tools of the table from 1500 til today). Can you believe the kind of colorful plastic and wooden spoons you get free with ice cream are sharing cases with Tiffany sterling silver ice cream saws, Napoleon’s travel service and George Washington’s forks? Check em out at 5th Avenue and 91st Street in Manhattan until October 29, 2006.

entry.title: Tribes Gallery Opening
entry.summary: Hey folks - just a quick note to let you know I have a video in a show that opens...
entry.content:
Hey folks - just a quick note to let you know I have a video in a show that opens this week. The show deals with the meeting of the elegant and the tragic, and the humor that arises as a result. (I'm paraphrasing there.) The opening is Thursday night at:

Tribes Gallery
285 East 3rd street #2

212 674 3778

I'll post the time as soon as I know it, but if I forget, give them a call. Best, George
